doc:
Florence Deshon https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Florence_Deshon 0 Florence Deshon (July 19, 1893 – February 4, 1922) was an American motion picture actress in silent films. Born in Tacoma, Washington, Deshon began her film career in 1915, appearing in The Beloved Vagabond, and would later star in numerous pictures for Samuel Goldwyn and Vitagraph Studios between 1918 and 1921. She was romantically involved with writer Max Eastman and actor Charlie Chaplin. She died of gas asphyxiation in her New York City apartment. Florence_Deshon ( July_19_,_1893 – February_4_,_1922 ) was an_American_motion_picture_actress in silent_films . Born in Tacoma , Washington , Deshon began her_film_career in 1915 , appearing in The_Beloved_Vagabond , and would_later_star in numerous_pictures for Samuel_Goldwyn and Vitagraph_Studios between 1918_and_1921 . She was romantically_involved with writer_Max_Eastman and actor_Charlie_Chaplin . She died of gas_asphyxiation in her_New_York_City_apartment .
